document.title: OmidZanganeh.com build + launch playbook
document.purpose: A complete, AI-friendly description of how this resume site is built, how to run it locally, how to deploy it, how DNS/domain + hosting are configured, and how to handle SEO/indexing.
audience: Another AI agent rebuilding a similar site from scratch

siteSummary.primaryGoal: Personal resume/portfolio website that showcases work experience, education, skills, projects, and provides a downloadable resume + contact form.
siteSummary.repositoryStrategy: GitHub repo is the source of truth; Vercel builds/deploys from main.
keyFeatures: Home resume page with two-column layout on desktop + responsive mobile layout
Interactive components (typewriter, count-up stats, skill radar, hobbies visualization, mini-games modal)
Visitor counter endpoint (and related API routes)
SEO essentials: metadata, JSON-LD Person schema, sitemap.xml, robots.txt, opengraph image

framework.name: Next.js
runtimeNotes: Uses file conventions for metadata (e.g., app/favicon.ico, app/opengraph-image.tsx, app/sitemap.ts, app/robots.ts)
Pages/components use client-side interactivity where needed via 'use client'

notes: Prefer CSS Modules for component encapsulation
Theme variables are defined via CSS custom properties for light/dark themes

dependencies: ioredis (optional, for visitor counting/storage depending on deployment configuration)

packageManager.expected: npm (or pnpm/yarn are fine if consistent)

importantPaths.purpose: Main resume page UI (header, sections, right sidebar, contact form).
Main page styling (grid layout, typography, section titles, sidebar rules, responsive behavior).
Global layout + metadata (SEO), JSON-LD, theme initialization.
Global theme variables + base resets and typography.
Favicon displayed in the browser tab.
Generates the social preview image (Open Graph).
Profile images used on the home page (randomly chosen on refresh).

prerequisites: Ensure npm is available in PATH (Windows: reinstall Node or enable npm).

commands.name: Install dependencies
commands.notes: Run once or when package.json changes.

commands.name: Build (production check)
commands.notes: Catches TypeScript and Next build issues.

commonLocalIssues.cause: Node/npm not installed or not on PATH
commonLocalIssues.fix: Install Node.js LTS, reopen terminal/IDE, verify with 'node -v' and 'npm -v'.
Hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R), use incognito, or clear site cache.

layout.desktop: Two-column grid: main content on left; sidebar on right; contact area placed to appear last on mobile.
layout.mobile: Single column with controlled order (main -> sidebar -> contact).

behavior: Fades + slides in when element enters viewport
Supports direction variants: up (default), right (sidebar fly-in), left

updateProcedure: Replace the file in public/ with the updated PDF (keep the same filename to avoid changing code).
Wait for Vercel deploy to finish.

profileImages.behavior: Home page randomly selects between the two on each refresh.
updateProcedure: Replace the image file inside public/ using the same filename.

buildSettings.output: Next.js managed output (no manual output dir)

notes: If visitor counting uses Redis, configure REDIS_URL (or equivalent) in Vercel project env vars.
Never commit .env files; they are gitignored.

postDeployChecklist: Visit the production URL on desktop and mobile.
Verify images load and look correct.

domainAndDNS.keyConcept: DNS records are edited wherever your domain's nameservers point (DNS host).

twoCommonSetups.howToDetect: Nameservers in Namecheap show Namecheap BasicDNS (dns1.namecheaphosting.com, etc.)
Nameservers set to Vercel DNS (ns1.vercel-dns.com, ns2.vercel-dns.com)
twoCommonSetups.whereToAddRecords: Vercel dashboard → Domains → select domain → DNS Records

steps: In Vercel project → Settings → Domains: add omidzanganeh.com and www.omidzanganeh.com (optional).
Vercel shows the required DNS records (A/CNAME) depending on your setup.
Add those records in your DNS host (Namecheap or Vercel DNS).
Wait for propagation, then confirm Vercel domain status is 'Valid Configuration'.
vercelDomainConnect.ssl: Vercel automatically provisions HTTPS certificates once DNS is correct.

steps: In Google Search Console: choose Domain property for omidzanganeh.com.
Copy the provided TXT record: google-site-verification=...
Add that TXT record at your DNS host (Namecheap if DNS is there; otherwise Vercel).
Wait for propagation (minutes to hours; sometimes longer).
troubleshooting: If Verify fails immediately, wait 15–60 minutes and try again.
If still failing, confirm you added the TXT record to the correct DNS host (nameserver check).
Use a DNS checker tool to confirm TXT record is visible publicly.
Ensure host/name is '@' (root) unless Google explicitly requests a subdomain.

currentImplementation.metadata: app/layout.tsx exports Next.js Metadata (title, description, openGraph, twitter, metadataBase).
currentImplementation.structuredData: JSON-LD Person schema embedded in <head> via layout.tsx.
currentImplementation.robots: app/robots.ts generates /robots.txt allowing crawling and pointing to sitemap.

indexingChecklist: Verify domain in Google Search Console.
Use URL Inspection to request indexing of key pages (/ and /projects).
Ensure no accidental noindex tags or blocked robots rules.
Ensure the site is publicly accessible without authentication.
practicalContentActions: Make sure the phrase 'GIS Developer' appears naturally in the visible hero/intro text and headings.
Create 1 dedicated page or section for 'GIS Projects / Case Studies' with keyword-rich headings and results.
Use internal links (homepage → projects; projects → individual project sections) if you add more pages.
authorityActions: Add your domain link to LinkedIn, GitHub, StoryMap, and other profiles (backlinks help).
Share the site in relevant communities (GIS forums, LinkedIn posts) to earn natural links.
technicalSeoActions: Optimize images (use Next/Image, keep file sizes reasonable).
Keep page load fast (avoid huge JS bundles).
Ensure mobile layout is clean and accessible.
Fix console errors and broken links quickly.

workflow: Run quick local check (npm run dev; optionally npm run build)
git add / commit with a clear message
noteOnLargeBinaryFiles: PDF and image files are binary; git commit output shows 0 insertions/deletions even when content changes.
Keep file names stable (e.g., public/Omid-Zanganeh-Resume.pdf) to avoid updating links.

security: Do not commit .env files or credentials (already gitignored).
If contact form sends email, protect from spam (honeypot/captcha) and avoid exposing API keys client-side.
analytics: Optional: add privacy-friendly analytics (Plausible, Umami) if desired; keep it minimal.
legalAndPrivacy: If storing visitor IP/location, add a short privacy note. Avoid collecting more than needed.
accessibility: Ensure keyboard focus states are visible and links are descriptive.
